    • Method Detail

      • gainExperience

        public boolean gainExperience(int experience)
        Parameters:
        experience - - The experience gained after a fight.
        Returns:
        true if the hero is ready to level up/False if not. The rate is adjustable by changing "400".

      • levelup

        public boolean levelup(int S,
                       int P,
                       int E,
                       int C,
                       int I,
                       int A,
                       int L)
        Parameters:
        S - - Attribute for Steamrolliness.
        P - - Attribute for Plasticness.
        E - - Attribute for Eagerness.
        C - - Attribute for Childishness.
        I - - Attribute for Injudiciousness.
        A - - Attribute for Aluminiumness.
        L - - Attribute for Looking.
        Returns:
        returns true if successfully leveled up. For detailed description of the Attributes see the documentation.

      • getInventory

        public Inventory getInventory()

      • getStats

        public Stats getStats()

      • Equip

        public boolean Equip(int index)
        Parameters:
        index - The index of an item from the inventory.
        Returns:
        returns true if item isn't equipped already and if it's successfully equipped. The way the method works is getting the attributes from the item and adding them to the hero's general stats temporary until unequippment.

      • unEquip

        public boolean unEquip(int index)
        Parameters:
        index - The index of an item from the inventory which is already equipped.
        Returns:
        returns true if item is equipped already and if it's successfully unequipped. The way the method works is getting the attributes from the item and removing them to the hero's general stats.

      • Action

        public int Action(int index)
        Parameters:
        index - - The action the hero takes
        Returns:
        integer on which action has the hero taken. Of input 0 it returns the damage the hero does with an attack. Of input 1 it returns 1 which is the identifier for skipping a turn. Of input 2 it returns the damage the hero does with an ability. Of an inaccurate input it returns -1.

      • receiveDmg

        public boolean receiveDmg(int index)
        Parameters:
        index - - The damage the hero takes.
        Returns:
        True if the hero's health points becomes zero or negative. It identifies that the hero is dead and the user needs to create a new one. False if the hero takes damage, but it doesn't die.

      • getProgress

        public HeroProgress getProgress()
